title: Young Tennis Star Wins Big Tournament
summary: Carlos Alcaraz, a 22-year-old tennis player from Spain, won the Australian Open final against Novak Djokovic. This victory made him the youngest man ever to win all four major tennis tournaments, called the Grand Slam. Alcaraz lost the first set but came back to win the match with scores of 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5. He celebrated by falling on the court in joy. Djokovic, who is 38 years old, was trying to win his 25th major title but did not succeed. Alcaraz is now the world number one and has won seven major titles. This win breaks an 87-year-old record held by Don Budge. Only nine men have won all four Grand Slam tournaments. The match took place in Melbourne, Australia, at the Rod Laver Arena.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. Major tournaments, called Grand Slams, are the biggest events in tennis. They include the Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open. Winning all four is a rare achievement called a career Grand Slam. Players like Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic compete to be the best. This article talks about a recent match where Alcaraz made history by becoming the youngest man to win all four.
Article_Structure: WHO: Carlos Alcaraz, a 22-year-old Spanish tennis player, and Novak Djokovic, a 38-year-old Serbian tennis player.
WHAT: Alcaraz won the Australian Open final against Djokovic to become the youngest man to complete a career Grand Slam.
WHERE: The match happened in Melbourne, Australia, at the Rod Laver Arena.
WHY: This victory breaks an 87-year-old record and shows Alcaraz's skill as a rising star in tennis.
